title: Command Line
content: The command line of $is2boot$$ can be accessed by pressing $iC$$ in the boot menu.$n
Below is a list of the standard commands available in the command line. The command line additionally accepts several debugging commands not listed here.

content.title: help
content: Prints a list of basic commands.

content.title: boot
content: Boots the menu entry given by the first argument, $C0$$ being the first menu entry.

content.title: Arguments
content: $bFirst argument:$$ A 0-based index specifying which menu entry to boot.

content.title: memmap
content: The memory allocation map printed out in a human readable format.

content.title: vmemmap
content: A map of all virtual memory ranges mapped.

content.title: cat
content: Prints out the contents of a file.

content.title: Arguments
content: $bFirst argument:$$ The absolute path to the file that should be printed out.

content.title: ls
content: Prints out the files in a directory.

content.title: Arguments
content: $bFirst argument:$$ The absolute path to the directory of which the files should be listed.

content.title: e820map (x86-only)
content: The memory map provided by BIOS interrupt 0x15, function 0xe820 $bor$$ UEFI boot services if running on a UEFI system.
